text: "Nice man, of course, excluded: my share of the favour," said Elizabeth, "do not make yourself unhappy."

passages.full_quote: <used>Nice man, of course, a</used> present before the present now, but that was just their fun ( and in any case he had other things on his mind

passages.fragment: , of course , excluded : my share of the
passages.full_quote: From every enjoyment I was, <used>of course, excluded: my share of the</used> gaiety consisted in witnessing the daily apparelling of Eliza and Georgiana, and seeing them descend to the drawing-room, dressed out in thin muslin frocks and scarlet sashes, with hair elaborately ringletted; and afterwards, in listening to the sound of the piano or the harp played

passages.fragment: my share of the favour , '' said Elizabeth
passages.full_quote: "I thank you for <used>my share of the favour," said Elizabeth</used>; "but I do not particularly like your way of getting husbands."
"My finge<used>rs," said Elizabeth, "do not</used> move over this instrument in the masterly manner which I see so many women's do"
sai<used>d he, "do not make yourself unhappy</used>"
